image.altText: A man with short black hair sits in a museum in front of a glass artwork depicting cabbage leaves on a wall.

props.synopsis: Blending contemporary artwork with archival material, a new exhibition at the National Museum in Canberra promises to captivate and educate visitors about the little-known history of Aboriginal-Chinese people in Australia.

title.children: New National Museum exhibit 'a celebration' of Aboriginal-Chinese people

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man is sentenced to nearly seven years jail after pleading guilty to five counts of aggravated rape, one act of indecency and a threat to kill committed against a 14-year-old girl over five days.

title.children: Man jailed for raping 14-year-old, threatening to kill her with machete

image.altText: Commonwealth park floriade

props.synopsis: The decision-makers behind Canberra's Parliamentary Triangle are sharing their ideas for the future of Commonwealth Park, but they want more input.

title.children: More flowers, a lakeside swimming pool and a Ferris wheel on the cards for Commonwealth Park

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: Angus Ross Robertson, 24, was charged with two counts of rape and two acts of indecency on the woman, who was a fellow cadet.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping fellow ADFA cadet

image.altText: A worker checks cable connection on a solar panel at a solar farm

props.synopsis: While experts weigh in on the great energy debate, one builder says the industry has already made up its mind.

title.children: In the debate between renewables and nuclear, some say it's 'game over'

image.altText: A small white fluffy glider with prominent ears, wide eyes and a little button nose peeks out of hole in a tree at night

props.synopsis: The South East Forest Rescue group alleged the Forestry Corporation of NSW did not conduct a broad area habitat search for features of habitat for three species of glider in a northern New South Wales forest.

title.children: High Court verdict provides 'hope amid an escalating extinction crisis'

image.altText: The exterior of a modern concrete building with a sign out front reading "High Court of Australia".

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Rodney Cherry loses his High Court bid for freedom, after the court refuses to overturn Queensland's no body no parole law.

title.children: Convicted killer Rodney Cherry loses appeal for freedom

image.altText: Andrew Laming

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Andrew Laming is disputing a fine he has been handed over content he posted online in the lead-up to the 2019 election that did not contain the required authorisations.

title.children: Former MP to appeal in High Court against fine for electoral law breaches

image.altText: School girls carry signs including 'Cool People don't deserve a warm planet', students march behind them.

props.synopsis: Shadow energy minister Ted O'Brien said climate targets would be reviewed under a Coalition government, but insists the party is committed to the Paris agreement.

title.children: Coalition says it's committed to Paris agreement, despite confusion

image.altText: Jeremy Cameron celebrates a Geelong goal as an Adelaide player sits near him

props.synopsis: Patrick Dangerfield and Jeremy Cameron dominate the last quarter as Geelong overturns a 30-point deficit to overrun Adelaide in a thrilling Gather Round opener at the Adelaide Oval.

title.children: Cameron and Dangerfield star as Cats stun Crows with epic comeback

image.altText: Panthers coach Ivan Cleary reacts during a press conference, holding his head up with one hand

props.synopsis: The Penrith Panthers will need to rewrite the record books in 2025 if they are to continue their historic success and claim a fifth-straight premiership.

title.children: Panthers must achieve 117-year first to continue premiership dynasty

image.altText: In vitro fertilisation

props.synopsis: Monash IVF has apologised after a woman unknowingly gave birth to a stranger's baby after the wrong embryo was transferred.

title.children: Woman gives birth to stranger's baby in Monash IVF embryo mix-up

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a polo shirt and cap at a press conference in queensland

props.synopsis: The prime minister tried to turn around Labor's fortunes in Queensland, the opposition leader visited a must-win Melbourne seat and a deadline looms in the NSW seat of Whitlam.

title.children: PM tries to win over Queensland with a little help from Tom Cruise

image.altText: The Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge just after sunset.

props.synopsis: Since last August, Australia has baked through above-average temperatures and the BOM is predicting another winter of unseasonable heat.

title.children: BOM predicts one of the warmest winters on record

image.altText: A student with a big backpack waits for a bus on a dirt road

props.synopsis: Regional leaders are welcoming the Coalition's pledge for a $20 billion regional future fund, but say it can't be another "exercise in bureaucracy".

title.children: Regional advocates say it's 'about time' for $20 billion future fund

image.altText: Firefighters in a burnt out building

props.synopsis: Authorities are investigating the cause of the blaze, and whether there were "any fire safety non-compliances".

title.children: Australian killed in fire at kids' cooking school in Singapore

image.altText: The tail of a Virgin Australia plane on the tarmac, with other planes lines up behind it.

props.synopsis: Customers were overcharged when changes were made to their itineraries, according to a spokesperson from Virgin Australia.

title.children: 'We sincerely apologise': Virgin to refund 61,000 overcharged customers

image.altText: Gout Gout crosses the finish line at the Australian Athletics Championships.

props.synopsis: With the aid of a tailwind over the legal limit, Gout Gout runs 9.99 seconds in both his heat and final in the U20 100 metres at the Australian Athletics Championships in Perth.

title.children: Gout Gout breaks 10 seconds for 100m twice with illegal tailwind

image.altText: The number "2073" emblazoned across what looks like a human-made tunnel.

props.synopsis: With journalists struggling to get people to take warnings about climate change and fascism seriously, a filmmaker stepped in. 2073 combines dystopian fiction with real-life footage from the world right now to send an important message.

title.children: Shocking scenes make up dystopian film 2073, using real-life footage

image.altText: Man in a suit speaking into a microphone behind a podium while holding up a chart

props.synopsis: Amid fears that the so-called reciprocal tariffs could cause a recession for the US, here's what it means for the global economy.

title.children: US President Trump pauses most 'reciprocal' tariffs. What we know

props.synopsis: Police are investigating an alleged assault on a beach on the Sunshine Coast that left a 60-year-old woman with broken ribs, spinal fractures, a fractured ankle, and a lacerated liver.

title.children: Woman suffers spinal injuries after dog owner 'rugby tackle' on beach

image.altText: A freestanding Victorian-era house painted white with black wrought iron balustrades on the lefthand side

props.synopsis: What would you risk for the house of your dreams? That's the question Melbourne couple Stephanie and Paul Ryan grappled with when the opportunity arose to buy a rundown Victorian-era house that's under the threat of compulsory acquisition.

title.children: Couple's gamble on forever home could mean 'torturous' forced sale

image.altText: A small plane with a damaged tail on a race track, as seen from above.

props.synopsis: The pilot was delivering the Bathurst 1000 trophy to the track on Mount Panorama last year when the violations occurred, investigators have found.

title.children: Pilot who flew damaged plane over racing fans breached rules, report finds

image.altText: Cathy crouched down with her chooks

props.synopsis: With egg shortages expected to last several years, demand for backyard chickens is soaring. Here's what you need to know before adopting some for yourself.

title.children: Considering adopting chickens in the egg shortage? Read this first

image.altText: Cody Walker walks on the field during an NRL game at Perth Stadium.

props.synopsis: The NRL is playing a double-header in Perth on Saturday, with a major supporter group saying a backlash is expected as talks of a West Australian team are put on hold.

title.children: 'There will be a backlash': Unfortunate timing of NRL's Perth double-header

image.altText: A captured crocodile in a pool.

props.synopsis: People leaving fish and pig carcasses at boat ramps along a crocodile-infested river in Queensland are being warned they are putting lives at risk.

title.children: 4.5m crocodile caught as reckless human behaviour increases risk

image.altText: A man whose face has been blurred is flanked by police as he leaves an airport.

props.synopsis: NSW Police flew to New Zealand on Monday and have returned with the 46-year-old accused.

title.children: Man extradited from NZ over alleged indecent assault of child

image.altText: an aerial view of Australian Native Landscapes facility near Blayney

props.synopsis: Levels of "forever chemical" PFOS downstream of the composting site are more than 650 times above ecological water guidelines.

title.children: EPA names composting facility as major PFAS contaminator of NSW river

image.altText: Sonia Ballal stands out the front of her house.

props.synopsis: Victoria's building regulator has warned consumers it is investigating a builder over allegations it has built potentially unsafe homes in Melbourne's outer suburbs.

title.children: Watchdog sounds alarm on Melbourne builder's 'defective work'

image.altText: A bald man.

props.synopsis: The leader of a far-right neo-Nazi group has failed in his efforts to get the court to remove a 'radical' bail condition barring him from communicating with other members of the group.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader tells court bail is 'impinging' his 'fundamental rights'

image.altText: An aerial photograph shows a sprawling mix of pink and beige buildings and palm trees on a beachfront property.

props.synopsis: As countries and markets grapple with the ongoing fallout from his tariff policy, some are wondering if Donald Trump has a bigger plan to overhaul global trade and reset America's industrial economy.

title.children: What is Trump up to? The so-called 'Mar-A-Lago Accord' could be a clue

image.altText: A woman in a royal blue sequin dress with a large peacock-like plumage, stands above a colour saturated cliff

props.synopsis: Kiri Pritchard-McLean has had to keep her stand-up career very separate from her life as a foster carer. But now she can bring the two together, with hilarious results.

title.children: This comedian wants to show the funny side of foster caring

image.altText: A woman with a shaved head reaches out at a woman carrying a toddler, who both have their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old woman who randomly attacked a toddler and an elderly woman in separate assaults in Perth is jailed for 18 months.

title.children: 'Out of control': Perth woman jailed for assaults on toddler, elderly woman

image.altText: A boa constrictor large snake slithering along a footpath near a bridge on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The large snake was spotted slithering down a footpath onto sand near a Sylvania bridge in Sydney's south.

title.children: Boa constrictor captured after days of being on the loose in Sydney's south
